dt: {bc}a meeting or series of meetings of a body (such as a court or legislature) for the transaction of business
{bc}a sitting of English justices of peace in execution of the powers conferred by their commissions
{bc}any of various courts similar to the English sessions
{bc}the period between the first meeting of a legislative or judicial body and the prorogation or final adjournment
{bc}the ruling body of a Presbyterian congregation consisting of the elders in active service
{bc}the period during the year or day in which a school conducts classes
{bc}a meeting or period devoted to a particular activity

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}session-, sessio{/it}, literally, act of sitting, from {it}sedēre{/it} to sit {ma}{mat|sit|}{/ma}
shortdef: a meeting or series of meetings of a body (such as a court or legislature) for the transaction of business
a sitting of English justices of peace in execution of the powers conferred by their commissions
an English court holding such sessions

dt: {bc}any of various state criminal courts of record

shortdef: any of various state criminal courts of record

dt: {bc}a former English local court with limited original and appellate criminal and sometimes civil jurisdiction and often administrative functions held quarterly usually by two justices of the peace in a county or by a recorder in a borough

shortdef: a former English local court with limited original and appellate criminal and sometimes civil jurisdiction and often administrative functions held quarterly usually by two justices of the peace in a county or by a recorder in a borough

dt: {bc}a presentation, discussion, or activity that takes place as part of a larger event (such as a conference, convention, or seminar) and for which some of the event's participants temporarily separate themselves from the others

dt.t: Wednesday's workshop will include two panel discussions … followed by a {wi}breakout session{/wi} with audience input.
With so many attendees, {wi}breakout sessions{/wi} are essential for one-on-one contact.

shortdef: a presentation, discussion, or activity that takes place as part of a larger event (such as a conference, convention, or seminar) and for which some of the event's participants temporarily separate themselves from the others

dt: {bc}a usually closed session (as of a legislative body) that functions as an executive council (as of the U.S. Senate when considering appointments or the ratification of treaties)

shortdef: a usually closed session (as of a legislative body) that functions as an executive council (as of the U.S. Senate when considering appointments or the ratification of treaties)

dt: {bc}an often impromptu performance by a group especially of jazz musicians that is characterized by improvisation

shortdef: an often impromptu performance by a group especially of jazz musicians that is characterized by improvisation

dt.t: Instead of a summer 2020 wedding, the couple decided to have a private {wi}photo session{/wi} where they posed for fake wedding photos.

dt: {bc}a meeting between a person who is a subject of a federal criminal investigation, the person's lawyer, and a prosecutor or investigator subject to the terms of a {d_link|proffer letter|proffer letter}

dt.t: {wi}Proffer sessions{/wi} are meetings between prosecutors and individuals who are the focus of an ongoing investigation. They are commonplace in criminal investigations. While a {wi}proffer session{/wi} carries the potential to reduce or resolve a client's criminal exposure, it also presents a great deal of risk.

shortdef: a meeting between a person who is a subject of a federal criminal investigation, the person's lawyer, and a prosecutor or investigator subject to the terms of a proffer letter
